job_description: You will be a member of the above group, which is responsible for: Students hired into Project Management will be given the opportunity to learn the coordination of engineering, procurement and construction services to deliver electrical, environmental, and civil work programs in support of the Green Energy Act.  Students will have exposure to telecommunications programs, power line and electrical sub-station projects.  Leadership and communication skills will be developed to instil confidence in the candidateâ€™s abilities. A strong element of this work-term is the development and execution of large scale commercial contracts for services and materials. Your job duties may include:Assist in monitor, control and direct projects and programs during the execution phase under the direction of a Senior Project Manager.Co-ordinate activities with Service Providers and stakeholders.Assist in resolving issues through negotiations with the Service Provider and customer.Prepare comprehensive reports and specifications, and present recommendations to resolve issues, producing documentation as necessary.Participant in the development, definition and preparation of programs, processes, technical/operational and business standards, procedures or methods, including risk management and costing, related to the management of transmission/distribution assets.Provide guidance to work and with, other interested groups in the implementation of recommendations.Assist in the preparation of contract specifications and awards and provide necessary technical guidance to Service providers.Monitor Service provider performance, provide re-direction where required, and authorize payment.Manage risks throughout the course of a project.  Develop and communicate risk response through acceptance, avoidance or mitigation.Contribute to the development of project strategies, plans and identify opportunities for cost savings.Contribute to the regular reports prepared by the department.Manage material required for projects.Other duties as required. This job will provide you with the following professional development:Working as part of a project team,Practice the application of engineering knowledge with respect to protection, control and station power systems.Gain the knowledge necessary to develop project plans.Experience with the management processes used to design, procure and construct  power systems for both Transmission and Distribution assets.Experience in a corporate environment working both independently and within teams on common objectives.
